section.para: The ngx_stream_limit_conn_module module (1.9.3) is used to limit the number of connections per the defined key, in particular, the number of connections from a single IP address.

directive.name: limit_conn
directive.para: When several limit_conn directives are specified, any configured limit will apply.
The directives are inherited from the previous level if and only if there are no limit_conn directives on the current level.

directive.name: limit_conn_dry_run
directive.para: Enables the dry run mode. In this mode, the number of connections is not limited, however, in the shared memory zone, the number of excessive connections is accounted as usual.

directive.name: limit_conn_log_level
directive.para: Sets the desired logging level for cases when the server limits the number of connections.

directive.name: limit_conn_zone

list.tag-desc: keeps the result of limiting the number of connections (1.17.6): PASSED, REJECTED, or REJECTED_DRY_RUN
